filmography.title: Shadow of a Doubt
filmography.role_description: A crime fiction obsessed neighbor who constantly discusses methods of murder with the protagonist's father; Cronyn's film debut.
filmography.plot: A young woman discovers that her visiting 'Uncle Charlie' may not be the man he seems, but a murderer on the run.

filmography.title: Phantom of the Opera
filmography.role_description: A police officer who serves as a rival suitor to the hero for the affections of the young soprano.
filmography.plot: A disfigured violinist haunts the Paris Opera House, committing murder to further the career of the soprano he loves.

filmography.title: The Cross of Lorraine
filmography.role_description: A Nazi collaborator who betrays his fellow French soldiers in a prisoner-of-war camp.
filmography.plot: A group of French soldiers surrender to the Germans expecting to be sent home, but are instead imprisoned in a brutal camp.

filmography.title: Lifeboat
filmography.role_description: The ship's radio operator who acts as the moral center of the survivors adrift in a lifeboat.
filmography.plot: Several survivors of a torpedoed merchant ship find themselves in the same lifeboat with one of the U-boat men who sunk them.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Top Ten Films

filmography.title: The Seventh Cross
filmography.role_description: A humble factory worker who risks his life and family to hide an escapee from a concentration camp.
filmography.plot: Seven men escape from a Nazi concentration camp, and the commandant vows to execute them all on seven crosses.

filmography.title: The Green Years
filmography.role_description: The stingy, miserly head of a Scottish household who begrudgingly takes in an Irish orphan.
filmography.plot: An Irish orphan is sent to live with his relatives in Scotland, where he struggles to find his path in life and love.

filmography.title: The Postman Always Rings Twice
filmography.role_description: The cunning and unscrupulous lawyer who manipulates the legal system to get his guilty clients acquitted.
filmography.plot: A drifter working at a roadside diner and the owner's wife hatch a plan to murder her husband.

filmography.title: Brute Force
filmography.role_description: A sadistic, ambitious prison guard captain who uses psychological torture to control the inmates.
filmography.plot: At a tough penitentiary, a prisoner plans a desperate escape to get away from a sadistic head guard.

filmography.title: People Will Talk
filmography.role_description: A petty, jealous academic who tries to dig up dirt on a popular and unconventional medical professor.
filmography.plot: A medical professor falls in love with a student who is pregnant by another man, while a colleague tries to ruin his career.

filmography.title: Crowded Paradise
filmography.role_description: The alcoholic, prejudiced superintendent of an apartment building who creates conflict for a Puerto Rican family.
filmography.plot: A young Puerto Rican man moves to New York City to marry his girlfriend but faces prejudice and poverty.

filmography.title: Sunrise at Campobello
filmography.role_description: The asthmatic, chain-smoking political advisor who pushes Franklin D. Roosevelt to return to politics after his illness.
filmography.plot: The story of Franklin D. Roosevelt's battle with polio and his family's struggle to support his return to political life.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Top Ten Films

filmography.title: Cleopatra
filmography.role_description: The loyal Greek astronomer and advisor to Cleopatra who remains by her side through her triumphs and downfall.
filmography.plot: Queen Cleopatra VII of Egypt experiences triumph and tragedy through her romances with Julius Caesar and Mark Antony.

filmography.title: Hamlet
filmography.role_description: A filmed version of the Broadway production featuring Cronyn's Tony Award-winning performance as the rambling counselor.
filmography.plot: A filmed record of the 1964 Broadway production of Shakespeare's play, starring Richard Burton.
filmography.awards: Tony Award: Win – Best Featured Actor (Play)

filmography.title: The Arrangement
filmography.role_description: The sinister, persuasive family lawyer who tries to pressure the protagonist into conforming to social expectations.
filmography.plot: A successful advertising executive suffers a nervous breakdown and re-evaluates his life and relationships.

filmography.title: Gaily, Gaily
filmography.role_description: A corrupt but charismatic political boss in early 20th-century Chicago who takes a young reporter under his wing.
filmography.plot: A naive young man moves to Chicago in 1910 and gets a job as a reporter, becoming involved in political corruption.

filmography.title: There Was a Crooked Man...
filmography.role_description: A pious, bickering con man in a prison who plans an escape with a cynical robber.
filmography.plot: A charismatic robber sentenced to a territorial prison in the 1880s plans a breakout and recovery of his loot.

filmography.title: Conrack
filmography.role_description: The rigid, prejudiced school superintendent who clashes with a progressive teacher on a remote island.
filmography.plot: A young white teacher takes a job on an isolated island off the coast of South Carolina and teaches his black students about the world.

filmography.title: The Parallax View
filmography.role_description: A skeptical newspaper editor who initially dismisses his reporter's conspiracy theory but eventually pays a price for his involvement.
filmography.plot: An ambitious reporter gets in way-over-his-head trouble while investigating a senator's assassination which leads to a vast conspiracy.

filmography.title: Honky Tonk Freeway
filmography.role_description: An elderly man traveling with his wife (Jessica Tandy), dealing with her alcoholism on a chaotic road trip.
filmography.plot: The mayor of a small Florida town bribes officials to get an exit ramp built for his town, leading to a chaotic convergence of travelers.

filmography.title: The World According to Garp
filmography.role_description: The stern father of Glenn Close's character, disapproving of her unconventional life choices.
filmography.plot: A struggling young writer finds his life and work dominated by his unfaithful wife and his radical feminist mother.

filmography.title: Impulse
filmography.role_description: A doctor in a small town who witnesses the residents' behavior becoming increasingly erratic and violent.
filmography.plot: A small rural town starts to exhibit strange and violent behavior after a minor earthquake seals a radioactive leak.

filmography.title: Brewster's Millions
filmography.role_description: The deceased, mischievous great-uncle who leaves a video will challenging his nephew to spend $30 million in 30 days.
filmography.plot: A minor league baseball player has to spend $30 million in 30 days in order to inherit $300 million.

filmography.title: Cocoon
filmography.role_description: A resident of a retirement home who regains his youth and health after swimming in a pool charged with alien energy.
filmography.plot: When a group of trespassing seniors swim in a pool containing alien cocoons, they find themselves energized with youthful vigor.

filmography.title: *batteries not included
filmography.role_description: An elderly diner owner who fights to save his building from developers with the help of tiny alien machines.
filmography.plot: Aliens help a feisty elderly couple protect their home from a ruthless developer.
filmography.awards: Saturn Award: Win – Best Actress (Jessica Tandy)

filmography.title: The Pelican Brief
filmography.role_description: A Supreme Court Justice whose assassination sets the plot of the political thriller in motion.
filmography.plot: A law student uncovers a conspiracy, putting herself and others in danger.

filmography.title: Marvin's Room
filmography.role_description: The bedridden, stroke-afflicted father cared for by his daughter; a role requiring acting almost entirely through movement and expression.
filmography.plot: A woman who has dedicated her life to caring for her father and aunt must reunite with her estranged sister when she is diagnosed with leukemia.

filmography.title: 12 Angry Men
filmography.role_description: The observant elderly juror who is the first to support the dissenter in this television remake of the classic courtroom drama.
filmography.plot: Twelve jurors must decide the fate of a Hispanic teenager accused of murdering his father.
